Dialogues.Key: "Oh! You brought the cave carrot! Thank you so much, Mr. @.$h^Oh! You brought the cave carrot! Thank you so much, Ms. @.$h"
Dialogues.Value: "О! Ты принёс пещерную морковь! Большое спасибо, Мистер @.$h^Oh! Ты принесла пещерную морковь! Большое спасибо, Мисс @.$h"

Dialogues.Key: "This looks great... I almost want to eat it myself!$h#$b#...almost."
Dialogues.Value: "Это выглядит здорово... Я почти хочу съесть его сам!$h#$b#...почти."

Dialogues.Key: "I hope it wasn't too much trouble... I really do appreciate it."
Dialogues.Value: "Я надеюсь это не вызвало много проблем... Я действительно ценю это."

Dialogues.Key: "Thanks again for helping me out.$h#$e#...and my goats say 'thanks' too."
Dialogues.Value: "Еще раз спасибо за помощь.$h#$e#... и мои козы скажут "спасибо" тоже."

Dialogues.Key: "@, you made it!$h#$b#I feel so relieved to be done with my book... it's like an elephant's been lifted off my shoulders."
"Well, I'd better get started with the reading... Wish me luck.$8"
"Good afternoon, everyone."
"Hi!"

"Ever since I was a young boy, I've dreamt of becoming a writer.#$b#When the time came for me to leave home and start my own life, I moved here. I was drawn to the peaceful beauty of the valley, and hoped that days of quiet reflection in this idyllic atmosphere would fan the literary flames."

"After countless hours scribbling at my writing desk, I present to you my first novel: 'The Rise And Fall Of Planet Yazzo'... It's a sci-fi epic spanning thousands of years in an exotic planetary system."

"Chapter One.#$b#Commander Yutkin stepped through the golden archway as the airlock snapped shut behind him. Today was his first day on Planet Yazzo, and all 14 of the alliance delegates had been summoned to the Grand Spire..."
"...And as the 7th moon descended beneath the horizon, the planet of Yazzo would begin its sinister transformation... an event for which Commander Yutkin was completely unprepared."
"Well, that concludes my reading. I'll be selling signed copies of the book by the front desk. Thanks for listening!$h"
"Well, how was it?"
"Thanks. $h#$b#You know, I got the idea for making a sci-fi book from you. Do you remember?#$b#That's why I've dedicated this book to you...$l"
"After countless hours scribbling at my writing desk, I present to you my first book: 'Blue Tower'... It's a mystery novel set in a surreal, dystopian future."

"Chapter One.#$b#From the shadows emerged a man, radiating with enigmatic omniscience. 'Good Evening, Mr. Lu,' he said, the corners of his mouth quivering. Lu seemed astonished. 'How did you know my name?'"
"Lu checked Jenu's pockets, then stood up and walked into the bedroom. He quickly found the small golden key that he was looking for and slipped it into his coat pocket."
"Well, that concludes my reading. I'll be selling signed copies of the book by the front desk. Thanks for listening!$h"
"Well, how was it?"
"Thanks. $h#$b#You know, I got the idea for making a mystery from you. Do you remember?#$b#That's why I've dedicated this book to you...$l"

"After countless hours scribbling at my writing desk, I present to you my first novel: 'Camellia Station'... It's a romance novel about a train stewardess who falls in love with a traveling architect..."

"Chapter One.#$b#'Your ticket, sir?' Ticket collector Gozman extended a gloved hand towards the young commuter. 'Ah, yes. I have it right here,' he replied, reaching into his coat pocket. Mortified, he discovered that the ticket was missing."

"...'Clara, there's something I must tell you,' he blurted as she turned to leave. Clara turned, slowly, and saw the look of desperation in Horatio's eye. At that moment Gozman burst into the compartment, red-faced."
"Well, that concludes my reading. I'll be selling signed copies of the book by the front desk. Thanks for listening!$h"
"Well, how was it?"
"Thanks. $h#$b#You know, I got the idea for writing a romance novel from you. Do you remember?#$b#That's why I've dedicated this book to you...$l"
"Abysmal...#$b#Not a single piece in the entire collection."
"What's this? You found something? Let me see it!"
"Remarkable!#$b#It's very old.#$b#I'd love to study this in greater detail... But it is yours."

"Hmmm...#$b#I've got a favor to ask you.#$b#Would you consider donating any new artifacts or minerals that you find?#$b#We could make a groundbreaking discovery together!#$b#Oh, and who knows... If you keep donating I might come across some interesting items to send your way."
"Think about it, will you?#$b#If you decide to donate, just bring the objects to the front desk."
"There you are... I was worried you didn't get my note.$6"
"It looks like we're alone.$8"
"The water feels so good after being out in the cold of night, doesn't it?$6"

"$q -1 null#Do you know why I asked you here tonight?$8#$r -1 0 event_pool1#You have something to tell me.#$r -1 0 event_pool2#I'm not exactly sure.#$r -1 0 event_pool3#You wanted to see me in my bathing suit."
"Um, how do I say this...$8"
"I've been meaning to tell you for a while now... about how I feel.$8#$b#I can't stop thinking about you...$8#$b#I've never felt this way about anyone.$8"
"$q -1 null#...$8#$r -1 0 event_pool4#I feel the same way about you.#$r -1 -1500 event_pool5#Sorry, but I don't like you in that way..."
"@! Come here, quick!$s"
Dialogues.Value: "@! Иди сюда, быстрее!$s"

Dialogues.Key: "My bracelet is gone! I know I had it on when I got here... $s#$b#But now it's gone and I can't find it anywhere...$s"
"$q 48 null#I'll never find another one like it...$s#$r 48 -30 Event_beach1#Relax, I'll just buy you a new one!#$r 48 50 Event_beach2#I'm really sorry..."
"Sorry, Great-Grandma. I lost your precious bracelet. Please forgive me.$s"
"Could she have dropped it nearby?"
"Is that...?$8"
"You found it!$h"
"Thank you so much, @. You're a lifesaver."
"I won't forget what you did for me here.$l"
"I really owe you one, @."
"Oh, hi."
"Um, it's @, right?"
"I'm just enjoying this great weather, @."
"Hmm...$u#$b#Hey, go long!$h"
"Heh... Nice try."

"I'm going to be the first professional gridball player from Stardew Valley... There's no doubt in my mind.#$b#I already led my school's team to the regional playoffs... Now I'm just training and getting stronger so I can claim my spot on the roster of the Zuzu City Tunnelers. You just wait!"
"#I believe in you!#Wow, you're really arrogant."
"Thanks, @. I'll remember that."
"Hey, that was fun, huh?"
"Hmmph... I think someone's a little jealous.$a"
"I'm out of here.$a"
"*sniff*...$s"
"Oh... @. You saw me crying.$s"
"It was today, twelve years ago... that my Mom died.$9"

"I still remember her well... she'd make salted radish sandwiches for lunch... and toss the gridball with me in the back yard.$9#$b#She took good care of me... and I was too young to really say 'thanks'. Now she's gone forever.$9"
"This is the only keepsake I have left... her secret music box.$s"

"$q -1 null#So... What are you thinking right now, @?$9#$r -1 0 event_box1#Honor your mother's memory by always doing your best.#$r -1 0 event_box2#You shouldn't dwell in the past.#$r -1 0 event_box3#I'll always be here for you if you get lonely.#$r -1 0 event_box4#Get over it. Life is hard for everyone."
"Well, there's no sense sitting around sniveling... let's head back to town.$9"
"Don't tell anyone I was crying. Okay?$7"
"Hey. I'm surprised to find you out here in the rain."
"Look at those dark clouds looming over the horizon..."
"I hope they come this way."
"I like this weather because it makes everyone disappear... you know?#$b#Being around people makes me feel anxious.$s"
"I don't feel that way around you, though.$7"
"We're getting soaked..."
"Here... There's room for two.$7"
"Hey."
"Look... I fixed up that old rowboat that's been sitting by my house. Pretty nice, huh?"
"@... Would you do me the honor of joining me for her maiden voyage?$l"
"Get in the boat?#Yes#No"

"So my book's been out for a while now... It's not a best-seller or anything, but it's been getting some good reviews from the critics.#$b#And I really couldn't have finished it without your moral support.$l"
"Actually, that's not true at all. I would've finished it either way.$h#$b#But I am grateful that you believed in me... in my vision. And, well..."
"Um... @? How do I say this...$8"
"Well, we've been friends for a while now... But I'm... I'm not sure if I feel that way about you anymore.$l"
"No! I'm not saying I want to cut all ties with you!$8#$b#In fact... quite the opposite.$l"
"...Let's see, how do I put this...?$l#$b#For once, I'm at a loss for words..."
"$q -1 null#@? You're trembling...$l#$r -1 50 event_boat1#I'm happy.#$r -1 -50 event_boat2#You're making me very uncomfortable. Stop."
"We'd better head back before the southern wind picks up.$l^Uh oh... The vibration from your body has caught the attention of a Crimsonfish... We'd better get out of here.$l"
"Look at the valley from here... it finally looks like 'Home'."
"*sigh*... What a day...$l"
"I see.$7"
"Hello @. Nice day, isn't it?"
"I'm just keeping an eye on my little brother. It's good for him to get some fresh air on a day like this."
"Our Dad used to take us to the beach on sunny days like this.$h"
"Is Dad ever going to come home?$s"
"Of course, Vince. Dad's going to come back as soon as he possibly can.$7"
"But I heard some grown-ups saying that... that all of our troops are getting shot to pieces.$s"
"Don't believe everything you hear!$8"

"Don't you remember how strong Dad is? He'd never let a pathetic Gotoro grunt get him like that! Don't you worry!$a#$b#And always remember that Mom and I are here to play with you if you ever feel lonely."
"Okay!"
"To be honest, I have no idea if my old man will come back... We've all read the reports. Our soldiers are falling by the thousands.$s#$b#But what am I going to say to Vincent?$7"
"#It's best to be honest with kids.#You did the right thing. Kids should have hope."
"You think so?$7#$b#Maybe you're right... The world is a cruel place, but kids have to learn that one way or another.$s~Yeah... kids should play and have fun while they still have the chance."
"Hey did I tell you the band's starting to come together?#$b#Yeah! It turns out Abigail's a pretty good drummer. And Sebastian seemed to really want her in the band...$h"
"Ahoy there, son.$u^Ahoy there, miss.$u#$b#Heard there was a newcomer in town... Good to finally meet ya.$u"
"Ah... I'm still tryin' to unwind from a month out on the salty seas...$h#$b#It was a big haul! I sold a lot of good fish.#$b#Finally saved enough to buy me a new rod.$h"
"Here, I want you to have my old fishing rod.$h#$b#It's important to me that the art o' fishing stays alive. And hey, maybe you'll buy somethin' from the shop once in a while.$h"
"There's good water here in the valley. All kinds o' fish."
"Oh yeah. My shop's back open now, so come by if you need supplies.$h#$b#I'll also buy anything you catch.#$b#'If it smells, it sells'. Heh heh. That's what my ol' Pappy used to say, anyway.$h"

"Hello! You must be @.#$b#I'm Robin, the local carpenter. Mayor Lewis sent me here to fetch you and show you the way to your new home. He's there right now, tidying things up for your arrival.#$b#The farm's right over here, if you'll follow me."
Dialogues.Value: "Привет! Ты должно быть @.#$b#Я Робин, местный столяр. Мэр Льюис послал меня встретить тебя и показать дорогу к твоему новому дому. Он уже там, приводит дом в порядок к твоему прибытию.#$b#Ферма прямо за углом, пойдём, я покажу."

Dialogues.Key: "This is %farm farm."
Dialogues.Value: "Это %farm ферма."

Dialogues.Key: "What's the matter?#$b#Sure, it's a bit overgrown, but there's some good soil underneath that mess!#$b#With a little dedication you'll have it cleaned up in no time."
Dialogues.Value: "Что такое?#$b#Конечно, она немного заросла, но под этим беспорядком есть хорошая почва!#$b#Немного преданности делу и ты очень быстро её очистишь!"

Dialogues.Key: "...And here we are, your new home.$h"
Dialogues.Value: "...И вот мы пришли, твой новый дом.$h"

Dialogues.Key: "Ah, the new farmer!$h"
Dialogues.Value: "Ах, новый фермер!$h"

Dialogues.Key: "Welcome! I'm Lewis, Mayor of Pelican Town.#$b#You know, everyone's been asking about you.#$b#It's not every day that someone new moves in. It's quite a big deal!"
Dialogues.Value: "Добро пожаловать! Я Льюис, Мэр города Пеликан.#$b#Знаешь, все очень интересовались насчет тебя.#$b#Не каждый день к нам переезжает новый человек. Это довольно важное дело!"

Dialogues.Key: "So... You're moving into your grandfather's old cottage.#$b#It's a good house... very 'rustic'."
Dialogues.Value: "Итак... Ты переезжаешь в старый дом своего деда.#$b#Это хороший дом... Очень 'винтажный'."

Dialogues.Key: "Rustic? That's one way to put it... $4#$b#'Crusty' might be a little more apt, though.$4"
Dialogues.Value: "Винтажный? Можно и так сказать... $4#$b#Хотя 'дряблый' может быть немного более уместно.$4"

Dialogues.Key: "Rude!"
Dialogues.Value: "Как грубо!"

Dialogues.Key: "Don't listen to her, @. She's just trying to make you dissatisfied so that you buy one of her house upgrades.$u"
Dialogues.Value: "Не слушай её, @. Она пытается тебя расстроить, чтобы ты купил одно из улучшений для дома, которые она продаёт.$u^Не слушай её, @. Она пытается тебя расстроить, чтобы ты купила одно из улучшений для дома, которые она продаёт.$u"

Dialogues.Key: "Hmmph."
Dialogues.Value: "Хммпф."

Dialogues.Key: "Anyway... You must be tired from the long journey. You should get some rest.#$b#Tomorrow you ought to explore the town a bit and introduce yourself.#$b#The townspeople would appreciate that."
Dialogues.Value: "Ну ладно... Ты наверное устал после долгой дороги. Тебе нужно отдохнуть.^Ну ладно... Ты наверное устала после долгой дороги. Тебе нужно отдохнуть.#$b#Завтра ты должен немного осмотреть город и представиться горожанам.^Завтра ты должна немного осмотреть город и представиться горожанам.#$b#Горожане будут признательны."

Dialogues.Key: "Oh, I almost forgot. If you have anything to sell, just place it in this box here. I'll come by during the night to collect it.#$b#Well... Good luck!"
Dialogues.Value: "Ох, чуть не забыл. Если у тебя есть что продать, просто положи вещи в этот ящик. Я загляну ночью и всё заберу.#$b#В общем... Желаю удачи!"

Dialogues.Key: "Hi @. Thanks for coming."
Dialogues.Value: "Привет @. Спасибо что пришёл.^Привет @. Спасибо что пришла."

Dialogues.Key: "Well, our gear's loaded already... Looks like everything's set."
"Alright, everyone... let's get in the bus!$u"
"*gulp*... I'm starting to get really nervous.$8"
"Okay, here we are... wish me luck!$u"
"Hey. The show was a great success! Thanks again, @."
"Hah!"
"This means nothing. I'll just run a 75%-off sale and all my customers will come crawling back to me, begging for forgiveness. You'll see!$h"
"No... Not this time, Morris.$u#$b#I think it's time we settled this once and for all.$u"
"Oh? And how do you propose we do that?$u"
"Hah! Primitive..."
"If you're too scared to fight me then bring one of your co-workers! Or are all Joja employees such cowards?$u"
"Insult me all you like... but don't you DARE slander the good name of Joja!$u"
"Pierre!"
"Ha! Good stuff!"
"You're even weaker than your fresh produce selection!$u"
"And the way you throw punches is just like Joja...$u#$b#Quantity over quality!"
"Get him!"
"Morris and his JojaMart cronies were never heard from again."
"@! Come in."
"Welcome to my humble... well, shack."
"This is my writing desk. It's where I spend most of my time."

"For as long as I can remember, I've wanted to be a writer. Have I told you that?#$b#That's why I live out here by myself. I figured a lonely life by the sea would help me focus on my literary aspirations...$s"

"Everyone back home said I was nuts... that I could never make it as a writer.#$b#Can you believe it? They said 'For every successful author there's 1000 who fail miserably'. Such pessimism... it's sickening."
"I can see it in your eyes... you believe in me, @. You've got that spark.#$b#Now that's inspiring! That's what I'm looking for..."
"$q 958699 null#A question... What kind of books do you like, @?#$r 958699 30 event_idea1#Mystery#$r 958700 30 event_idea2#Romance#$r 958701 30 event_idea3#Sci-Fi"
"Well! Enought talk about me!"
"Hmm... you probably know a lot about plants, don't you?"
"Would you mind taking a look at this rose, here? I'm afraid it's not doing so well.$7"
"Thanks for talking with me... I'll be thinking about what you said."
"Ah... I thought someone was there.$7"
"#That was wonderful.#How long have you been playing?"
"Thank you. I'm not very good, but it's fun to play.$h"
"Oh, I'm not sure... I've been dabbling in piano since I was a kid.$7#$b#I'm not very good, but it's fun."
"I've been working day and night to try and finish my book... It's been driving me insane, @.$s"
"An occasional tune is the only recreation I allow myself.$7"
"There's just too much work to do! And my bank account's starting to run dry.$7#$b#Sometimes I wish I could just throw it all away and become a farmer like you.$h"
"#It's just as hard to be a farmer, you know.#Come live on the farm, I could use the extra help."
"You're right... that was an insensitive thing to say.$8"
"What I meant is that I'd like to get away from this dark, musty prison and experience a little bit of real life... that's all.$s"
"*sigh*... sorry I'm complaining like this. I just need someone to talk to now and then.$7"
"Seriously?$8"
"It sounds wonderful... but I can't give up on my novel. It's already half-way done.$7"
"*sigh*... sorry I'm complaining like this. I just need someone to talk to now and then.$7"
"Hi. Um... I just wanted to say sorry for acting so weird yesterday.#$b#You probably understand what happened...$l#$b#Uh, okay...bye."
"Hi @. Guess what? My band is playing a show tonight, in Zuzu City!#$b#Meet me at the bus stop around 4:00 this afternoon to leave for the show. You better be there!"
"I'm excited and a little nervous for the show tonight. I'm sure everything will turn out okay."
"Hi @! Are you free this afternoon?#$b#I finally got my act together and I'm doing my art show tonight in the town square!$h#$b#Come into town between 3:00 and 5:00 pm if you want to be there!"
"I'm nervous...$l"
"Um, hello there. My name's Kent. I just got back last night... from overseas. My wife told me that a new farmer had moved in while I was gone."
"Well, I just wanted to introduce myself... I'll see you around."
"Uh... Hi there. Good morning.#$b#I noticed that you've been breaking some rocks open and finding ore. That's good!"
"If you want to get the most out of the ores you find, you'll need a furnace."
"Just so happens I had an extra set of blueprints lying around. Here, I want you to have them."
"Learned how to craft a 'Furnace'"
"The furnace allows you to smelt metal bars. The bars can be used for crafting, construction, and tool upgrades."
" When you've smelted a few copper bars, consider having me upgrade one of your tools. It can make your work a lot easier.#$b#Well, okay. I'm heading home. Take it easy."
"Hi, @. Beautiful day, isn't it?"
"I brought you a gift.#$b#It's a sculpture I've been working on, just for you."
"It's called... 'How I Feel About @'. I hope you like it."

"Hi @! I have some good news for you. A few days ago I made a breakthrough in my research on the local environment.$h#$b#I'll spare you the technical details and get to the point... You know that empty cave over there, a little ways to the west? Well, I have a way to turn it into something useful... for both of us.#$b#I'd like to set up the cave to attract some local species. That way I can observe them in a more controlled environment. And you can harvest whatever products they produce.#$b#I can either set up the cave to attract mushrooms or fruit bats. The bats will sometimes leave fruit for you to collect."
"Alright! I'll go set it up for you right now! It shouldn't take any time at all.$h#$b#Thanks for letting me do this."
"I'm excited to see what happens with that cave. Aren't you?#$e#I hope you're pleased with the work I did."

"Oh, good morning Mr. @!^Oh, good morning Ms. @!#$b#I hope it's not too early...$s#$b#Well, I just wanted to stop by and thank you in person for all the wonderful artifacts and minerals you've discovered... you've done so much for one person!$h#$b#In fact, I've just recieved a letter from the office of the regional secretary of artifacts... We're being honored with the coveted 'golden shovel' award for our significant contributions to the field!#$b#And it's all thanks to you!$h#$b#Well, I should let you get back to your work..."
"Oh! I almost forgot!#$b#I have a gift for you... It's an old key that's been sealed in the museum vault for at least 100 years. It's a little rusty, but still beautiful.$h"
"You got the 'Rusty Key'! It's been added to your wallet"
"Bumped into Robin this morning... she told me you've got a new Slime Hutch!"
"Not bad!"
"I was into slime breeding at your age. It's a great hobby... but dangerous.#$b#How'd you think I lost this eye?"
"Hah!"
"Just Kidding."
"Here, I've got something for you."

"It's a slime egg. You can place that inside a slime incubator to hatch it.#$b#Now, take a good hard look at that egg. Next time you're out slime-hunting keep your eyes peeled for more eggs. They're rare, but slimes do drop them from time to time.#$b#Collect eggs from different slimes to add some variety to your herd!"
"Hello @!$h#$b#You see this cat here?"
"I found it sitting outside the entrance to your farm! I think it's a stray... poor little thing.$s"
"I think it likes this place! Hey, um.... Don't you think this farm could use a good cat?$h"
"Well, little %pet... You be a good kitty now... okay?"
"Hello @!$h#$b#You see this dog here?"
"I found it sitting outside the entrance to your farm! I think it's a stray... poor thing.$s"
"Hey, it seems to like this place! Hey, um.... Don't you think this farm could use a good dog?$h"
"Well,  %pet... You be a good pooch now... okay?"

"Good morning, Mr. @!$h^Good Morning, Ms. @!$h#$b#I came by to ask you a favor, since you're such a kind neighbor.#$b#You see, I'm trying to train my goats to say 'hello'... but they simply won't pay attention to me unless I have their favorite treat, cave carrots!$u#$b#So... since I'm scared of the mines... I thought, well, maybe you would bring me a cave carrot when you have the chance?#$b#There's no pressure... but if you want to, just swing by my house between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM with a cave carrot. You'll make an old girl very happy. Bye."
"My goats go wild over cave carrot... I can't imagine why."
"*puff* ...hi @! *pant* Whew... that was quite a workout, walking all the way up here.$h"

"Anyway... I came by to ask if you wanted to have dinner with us tonight!#$b#You don't have to... but if you decide to come, could you please bring a largemouth bass with you?#$b#...that's right. One of those big, slimy fish from the lake. I need one for the casserole I'm making.$h#$b#Okay, well... it'll be at our house at around 7:00 PM tonight... don't forget the largemouth bass! Bye."
"Fish casserole always hits the spot."

"Hello there, @. So! Your first year in Stardew Valley is almost over, huh?#$b#If you keep buying seeds from me, you'll be twice as productive next year!$h#$b#And I have some exciting news...#$b#I'll be selling new seed varieties in my shop next year! I should have 1 new variety per season.#$b#...Well, that's all I wanted to say. Have a good one."
"You know... I wouldn't even bother trying my competitor's seeds.$u#$b# Pierre's seeds are the *highest* quality seeds you'll find anywhere. That's a promise.$h"

"My dear boy...^My dearest grand-daughter...#$b#It's been many years since we last spoke. You were just a little boy... Do you remember?^It's been many years since we last spoke. You were just a little girl... Do you remember?#$b#Look how far you've come!#$b#Though you may have forgotten me, I've been here all along.#$b#You see... My body has departed this world, but my heart will always remain in Stardew Valley."
"You've been here two years now..."
Dialogues.Value: Вы были здесь двумя годами ранее...

Dialogues.Key: "The future of %farm Farm is in your hands, now.#$b#Farewell!"
Dialogues.Value: "Будущее %фермы находится в твоих руках, сейчас.#$b#Прощай!"

Dialogues.Key: "My dear boy...^My dearest grand-daughter...#$b#I'm glad you summoned me. I... was perhaps a little too harsh with you last time.#$b#Forgive me. You've been working very hard, and I'm proud of it."
"Let's see..."
Dialogues.Value: Давай посмотрим...

Dialogues.Key: "The lighting is so nice right now... I had to come out and take some nature shots."
"I've been trying to connect with the outdoors a little more...#$b#I wanna know what it's like, being a farmer. It's a way of life I've never really thought about.#$b#Well, until now...$l"
"Heh, these cows are so cute..."
"Hey, I have an idea!$h"
"Let's take some pictures with these cows! You can show me how to approach one.$h#$b#I'll just set it to shoot on a timer."
"*giggle*$10#$b#That was fun, @! ...And these photos are hilarious!$10"
"I'm gonna go home and take a shower now...$10"
"Well, that was the dirtiest I've ever been.$h"
"Oh! @! You scared me.$6"
"See that fruit up there? It looks delicious, doesn't it?#$b#But I can't reach it.$s"
"Aghh!$6#$b#Hehe...Thanks.$h"
"Okay... got it!"
"You're stronger than you look!$h"
"Here, try a piece... "
"You know, I just realized something.#$b#Even if my art career is a flop, I'll always have a friend to catch me on the way down.$h"
"Thanks for helping me earlier...$h"
"Hi @. I knew you'd be passing through here today.#$b#...So I put together a surprise...$h"
"It's a little picnic for us!$h"
"This is a vegetable medley, with my 'special' spice blend."
"...and this is a fresh salad, made from greens that I foraged right here in the forest!$h"
"I just want to say thank you... for helping me get one step closer to becoming a real artist.$l"
"DISTANT VOICE: Well, well, well... What have we here?"
"Kel??$6#$b#What the heck are you doing here?$a"
"KEL: Didn't you see me at the art show? I came all the way from Zuzu City to see your sculptures."
"KEL: And to get you to come back with me."
"KEL: I want things to go back to the way they were... I miss you, babe."
"Yuck, don't call me that!$a#$b#You never supported my art before... now that I've had some success you want me back? You make me sick.$a"
"KEL: Hey! Come Here!"
"#Punch Kel in the face.#Try reasoning with Kel."
"Oh my God!$6"
"Well, he'll make it... but that was pretty violent, @.^She's fine... but that was pretty violent, @."
"Let's get out of here. I don't think Kel will be bothering us anymore."
"Let's find a more secluded spot this time...$l"
"Well, the picnic didn't pan out like I wanted it to.$h"
"KEL: I found your online art store... weren't you wondering about the 'Mr. K' who kept buying all your sculptures?"
"You're 'Mr. K'? I... I thought it was just a rich guy who truly loved my art.$s"
"KEL: Heh. Well, you were half right..."
"KEL: Look, Leah. I want you back. I miss you, babe."
"Ew, don't call me that!$a#$b#You never supported my art before... now that I've had some success you want me back? You make me sick.$a"
"KEL: Hey! Come Here!"
"#Punch Kel in the face.#Try reasoning with Kel."
"Oh my God!$6"
"Well, he's fine... but that was pretty violent, @.^She's fine... but that was pretty violent, @."
"Let's get out of here. I don't think Kel will be bothering us anymore."
"Let's find a more secluded spot this time...$l"
"Well, the picnic didn't pan out like I wanted it to.$h"
"KEL: I have nothing to say to you. Get out of my way."
"Urgghh! I always clean under the cushions! It's YOUR turn this week!$a"
"You're being childish, Haley. I do the vast majority of work in this house, and you know it.$u"
"Oh, it's that new farm boy.$7^Oh, it's that new girl from the farm.$7"
"He has a name, you know.$u^She has a name, you know.$u"
"Hey, I bet you'll understand my point of view here."
"*sigh*... I'm really sorry to involve you in this, @. Haley is complaining because I asked her to clean under the cushions.$u"

"$q 45 null#It's only because I cleaned them last week!$a#$r 46 -50 Event_clean2#Stop whining and just clean it!#$r 45 30 Event_clean1#Haley, why not have this be your one weekly job?#$r 46 -30 Event_clean3#Emily, take the high road and do it this time."
"Alright, you win. I guess this can be my job every week. Then there won't be any reason to argue over it.$u"
"Thanks, @. That was a great solution.$h"
"*sigh*... I guess I'll just do it, then...$s"
"Nnnnnghhh... I just can't get this jar open!$a#$b#...$s"
"Oh! It's you...@, right?"
"$q 47 null#Say... you're pretty strong, aren't you?#$r 47 30 Event_jar1#Yes#$r 47 -30 Event_jar2#No"
"Hey, you did it! You're stronger than you look!$h"
"Thanks!$h"
"Come in! Just make sure to close the door quickly behind you!"
"@, you're here!"
"Welcome to my brand new dark room!$h"
"$q -1 null#So... what do you think?#$r -1 10 Event_darkroom1#It looks great!#$r -1 0 Event_darkroom2#What does it do?#$r -1 -50 Event_darkroom3#I've seen better."
"Um... so, anyway... what do you want to do?$s"
" #Offer to help decorate the dark room.#Make an excuse and leave.#Try to kiss her."
"Oh, @... I've been waiting so long for you to do that.$11"
"One moment...$l"
"That was nice...$l"
"Come in, @! I want to show you something.$h"
"It's my secret hobby... I've been practicing for months.#$b#Now, let these sounds and motions carry you away to a new plane of consciousness."
"$q 213 null#So, what did you think?$h#$r 213 25 event_dance1#That was amazing!#$r 213 -50 event_dance2#That was embarrassing...#$r 213 25 event_dance1#(Say nothing and do a slow clap)"
"Phew... that was quite a workout...$u#$b#I haven't been this sweaty since I ordered the pepper platter at Abigail's graduation fiesta!$h#$b#...Well, I'd better take a shower. See you later."
"Don't tell anyone about the dance. I want to surprise them, too."
"Sorry I'm all disheveled... I didn't know you were coming over.$h"
"Hey, I think I hear a plane overhead..."
"@, get over here!"
"Look!"
"As a kid, my dream was always to be a pilot."
"...But with my bad eyesight and a crippling fear of heights, that dream started to fade away.$s"
"It's okay... don't be sad.#$b#I've grown to accept my station in life. Not everyone can achieve their dreams... that's just the way the world is."
"Hey, let me show you my model airplanes. I just finished the new TR-Starbird deluxe set.$h"
"*sigh*... I'm so sick of preparing these samples...$s"
"Agh! Oh no!... $4"
"The whole sample is ruined... Harvey's going to kill me...$s"

"$q 38 null#@, what should I do?#$r 38 -50 Event_Hospital_1#Just scoop it off the floor. He won't know the difference.#$r 39 -20 Event_Hospital_2#Tell Harvey it was my fault.#$r 38 50 Event_Hospital_3#Tell Harvey it was an accident."
"What happened? I heard something break."
"$p 38#I accidentally dropped one of the samples... I'm so sorry.$s|@ came in and slammed the door so loud I dropped this sample.$u"
"You shouldn't blame others for your own problems, Maru.$a"
"*sigh*... I'll have to call the patient back in to recollect this sample.$s#$b#This'll probably put us in the red for another month...$s"
"Thanks for telling me the truth, Maru.#$b#Don't worry about the sample, we'll just get another one."
"Thanks for being patient with me, Doctor Harvey."
"Of course... you've been a big help around here. I don't know what I'd do without you!"
"@? You look a little pale... are you feeling okay?"
"Ah, @! I was just about to write you a letter."
"You see, my records indicate that you're due for your annual checkup!"
"Now, now... There's no need to worry. It'll be quick and painless. Please follow me."
"Hmm... Okay. Hold still, please."
"Say 'ahhh...'"
"Okay, you can stop."
"I just need to check your vitals."

"$q 86 null#Hmm... Your pulse is high.$u#$r 86 20 event_heart1#I'm a little nervous...#$r 86 20 event_heart2#I'm out of breath from working on the farm.#$r 86 -50 event_heart3#Are you really a doctor? My pulse is fine!"
"Well, then! You seem very healthy, @.#$b#Just make sure not to overwork yourself on that farm!"
"Thanks for stopping in.$h"
"Hello? Hello? Is anyone out there?$9"
"This is Dr. H at... 52 North 43.5 East... Seeking aerial response...Anyone out there?$9"
"Copy.. Dr. H on the ground... this is Blackbird Fiver Fiver Zuzu. Anything to report?"
"Someone's there!?$10#$b#Er... I mean!... Standard ground report: Wind at 3 Clicks, 36 Degrees North of West. Ground Temperature at 42 Kraggs. Humidity 53%. Dr. H out!$10"
"Yikes, my pulse is soaring...$7"
"#Ask Harvey why he's all flustered.#Pretend like everything's normal."
"Ah, well... You see, I was just on my radio here... and I made contact with a real pilot!"
"As a matter of fact, we can probably see him flying overhead right now!"
"Quick, get over here!"
"Look!"
"As a kid, my dream was always to be a pilot."
"...But with my bad eyesight and a crippling fear of heights, that dream started to fade away.$s"
"It's okay... don't be sad.#$b#I've grown to accept my station in life. Not everyone can achieve their dreams... that's just the way the world is."
"Hey, let me show you my model airplanes. I just finished the new TR-Starbird deluxe set.$h"
"Nnnnggghh....I just can't reach it!$u#$b#If only I could get up from this infernal chair...$s"
"Thanks, young man.^Thanks, miss."

"*sigh*...It happened 30 years ago.$s#$b#I was working in the coal mines. We were near the end of our shift, but there was one last seam that needed to be broken up.#$b#I went in there aiming to set off a stick of dynamite, but my foot slipped into a crack and I dropped it. The dynamite exploded on impact."
"The next thing I remember, I was laying in the hospital... and they told me I'd never walk again."
"So there you have it. You probably figured I was just too old to walk.#$b#Well I'll have you know that I'd be spryer than a spring chicken if I hadn't been in that accident!"
"You've been very nice to me, young man. I appreciate that.^You've been really nice to me, miss. I appreciate it.#$b#When you're old, you start to forget that anyone cares about you."
"Oh! @! You're wondering what that good smell is?#$b#Why, that's nice of you to say! I'm actually baking my famous cookies!$h"
"Here, why don't you try one?"
"$q 51 null#Well, what do you think?#$r 51 100 Event_cookies1#It's delicious!#$r 51 -100 Event_cookies2#It was like chewing on a hockey puck"
"I think I've come to know you well enough to give you my recipe. Just make sure to keep it a secret.$h"
"Learned how to make 'Cookies'"
"*sigh*$s"
"Oh, Hi @.$s"
"Look at all these books. I haven't read a single one. Just the thought of cracking one open makes me nervous.$s#$b#But you can't make a decent living in this world without a brain...$s"

"$q 57 null#I'm worthless...$s#$r 57 0 Event_books1#That's crazy. You're a genius!#$r 57 50 Event_books2#We all have our strengths and weaknesses#$r 57 -50 Event_books3#Worthless? Yeah, that about sums it up."
"Well, I'm not going to give up!$a"
"If I work hard, I can do anything!"
"Hey, maybe one day soon we'll have dinner and discuss ....phi-lo-so-phy. Isn't that what you smart people talk about?$h"
"Oh! Hey... I was just doing my daily strength training routine.$6#$b#... sorry I have no shirt on.$6"
"Uh... @? I've been meaning to talk to you about something...$8"
"I've started to realize that... well, that I've been really rude towards you in the past. You know, about going pro and all that.$8"

"I guess I might not actually be cut out for professional sports... maybe it was just a childish dream... you know?$8#$b#Anyway... I want to apologize to you for bragging and being annoying about it. I appreciate that you stayed friends with me through all that.$6"
"Okay, George. I want you take a deep breath for me."
"Mmhmm... turn around, please."

"George, I'll be honest with you. You need to make some changes in your lifestyle if you want to stay healthy.#$b#I'd like you to reduce your sodium intake, and try to get some moderate exercise with your arms."
"Hmmph... I know what's best for me. Who do you think you are, telling me how to live my life?"
"I'm your doctor, George. That's who I am...#$b#And I went to school for 8 years so I could learn how to help people stay healthy."
"Oh!#$b#I'm sorry, but you shouldn't be here... these check-ups are supposed to be private."
"Not so fast! I'd like to get a second opinion from this young man.^Not so fast! I'd like to get a second opinion from this young lady."
"Very well..."
"$q 84 null#@, what do you think George should do?#$r 84 40 event_george1#George should follow Dr. Harvey's advice.#$r 85 -40 event_george2#George knows what's best for his own body."
"Fine. I'll do what you say, doctor."
"$p 84#Thanks for your help, @. I appreciate it.$h|It's better not to give my patients mixed messages, @. Please remember that in the future."
"Oh, hi @! Come in, come in."
"I'm just working on this sculpture here."
"Come here. Watch this."
"See that? I'm revealing the essence of the wood."

"$q -1 null#Once you get past the outer layers, the true nature starts to show...#$r -1 0 event_sculpt1#It's the same with people.#$r -1 0 event_sculpt2#I actually prefer the look of raw, unadultered wood.#$r -1 -100 event_sculpt3#(creepy) May I have a kiss?"
"I first visited this valley as a little girl, while on vacation with my parents.#$b#I knew I had to come back some day... This place has great artistic potential!"
"Although, I have to admit... It's not easy to pay the bills as an artist.$s"
"#Why don't you have an art show in town?#Why don't you sell your art on the internet?"
"Hmmm... interesting. I guess that could set the wheels in motion to making Pelican Town a true art destination...$7"
"But what if no one likes my sculptures? I'd be crushed.$s"
"...I'll have to think about it.$s"
"Well, thanks for stopping by, @."
"An art show for the whole village? That's a bold idea, @."
"Hmm... I guess that's an idea... But I'd need a computer first.$7"
"And again... that's expensive.$s"
"Well, it was nice of you to visit..."
"Kel...How many times do I have to tell you? I don't want to come back to the city!$8#$b#Stop calling me... I don't want to hear from you anymore! *click*$8"
"So I guess you heard me yelling on the phone?$s"
"That was my ex...$s"
"I guess I'd better tell you a little about it...$u"

"We had an apartment together, back in the city.$u#$b#I did odd jobs during the day and spent all night working on art projects... we barely made enough to scrape by.$u#$b#He was always nagging me to go back to school and study business or medicine... something with a lot of money in it.$a^She was always nagging me to go back to school and study business or medicine... something with a lot of money in it.$a#$b#I guess the idea was to save up for a normal life. You know... a house in the suburbs, kids, PTA meetings... that sort of thing.$u"
"I wasn't ready for that kind of life, @... I had to leave. So I came here to pursue my dream of being an artist."

"$q 83 null#Was that selfish of me, @?$s#$r 83 0 event_parents1#No, it had to be done.#$r 83 0 event_parents2#No, and your ex sounds like an idiot.#$r 83 -20 event_parents3#No, but you would've been better off staying in the city.#$r 83 -20 event_parents4#Yeah, a little.#$r 83 -20 event_parents5#Yeah, but it's natural to care about yourself first."
"Well, thanks for listening to me. It's good to have a friend."
"Hey, thanks for listening to me so patiently earlier."
"Hey! Come check this out."
"I bought a laptop and set up an online art shop... like you suggested."
"Did you hear that? That means someone just bought something from the store!$h"
"Hmm... There's this 'Mr. K' that keeps buying all my sculptures.$7#$b#I guess it must be some rich guy who loves my stuff."
"Wow! I'm not going to have to worry about my electricity bill for a while after that sale...$6"
"Anyway... Thanks for giving me this idea, @. So far, it's been really successful! This is really going to give me the funding I need to keep working on art full-time.$h"
"Now, sorry to ignore you... but I really need to tweak these CSS sheets...$7"
"Sorry... I shouldn't get angry.$s"

"Maybe you're right... my life would've been a lot easier if I had stayed.$u#$b#Maybe it's better to be practical and realistic... for all I know my art career will never pan out and I'll live my final years in squalor.$s"
"Well, thanks for listening to me. It's good to have a friend."
"So I've been saving up money to buy a computer... You know, so I can try and sell my art online like you suggested."
"It's good to have a friend looking out for you!"

"Anyway... I've been thinking a little more about that art show idea you had.#$b#I'm working on some new sculptures to display at the show... I'm nervous, but the thought of getting my work out there is pretty exciting.#$b#I'm just glad you're on board with making Stardew Valley a premier art destination, @!$h"
"$q 776589 null#*sniff*$s#$r 776589 20 Event_Cave2_1#What happened?#$r 776589 40 Event_Cave2_2#Are you okay?"
Dialogues.Value: "$q 776589 null#*sniff*$s#$r 776589 20 Event_Cave2_1#Что случилось?#$r 776589 40 Event_Cave2_2#Ты в порядке?"

Dialogues.Key: "You know I've been practicing my swordsmanship for a while...$9#$b#Well I decided today would be the day I venture into the caves...$8"
"...but I got scared. I couldn't do it.$8"
Dialogues.Value: "...но я испугался. Я не мог этого сделать.$8"

Dialogues.Key: "$q 34 null#I guess I'm not as tough as I thought...$8#$r 34 20 Event_Cave_1#You're safe with me.#$r 34 40 Event_Cave_2#I get scared too.#$r 34 -50 Event_Cave_3#You're crying like a little baby. Stop."
"@, I... I really like you... And not just as a friend. You know that, right?$l"
Dialogues.Value: "@, Ты... Ты действительно мне нравишься... И не просто как друг. Ты это знаешь, ведь так?$l"

Dialogues.Key: "I can't believe I'm actually saying this... But I can't keep it in anymore. I've felt this way for a long time.$l"
Dialogues.Value: "Я действительно не могу поверить, что я это говорю... Но я не могу больше это сдерживать. Я чувствовала себя такой, уже долгое время.$l"

Dialogues.Key: "You don't have to say anything right now. Let's just stay here for a while...$l^I didn't know I felt this way about other girls... until I met you."
"Hmmm... "
Dialogues.Value: "Хмммм..."

Dialogues.Key: "...I was just peering down into this old mine shaft.#$b#It's been abandoned for decades."
"Still, there's probably good ore down there.#$b#But a dark place, undisturbed for so long... I'm afraid ore isn't the only thing you'll find..."
"Here, take this. You might need it."
Dialogues.Value: "Вот, возьми это. Тебе это может понадобится."

Dialogues.Key: "Name's Marlon, by the way. I run the adventurer's guild right outside.#$b#I'll keep my eye on you. Prove yourself and I might think about making you a member."
"$q 32 null#@! Why are you out here in the rain?$7#$r 32 0 Event_Rain_1#Just doing some work#$r 32 50 Event_Rain_2#Enjoying the weather#$r 32 10 Event_Rain_3#I could ask you the same question"
"...I came here to spend some time alone.$8"
"But I don't mind your company!"
"You're getting soaked... come stand under the tree."
"It's impossible to describe this feeling... watching the curtains of rain whisper above a silent lake.$8"
"Hey! A mini-harp!$h#$b#You're full of surprises, @. I'm impressed."
"@! I'm surprised to see you here so late."
"The night sky looks amazing right now."
"Come over here, I want to show you something."
"Here, take a peek."
"$q 40 null#What do you see?#$r 40 30 Event_Space1#A beautiful planet.#$r 40 -30 Event_Space2#A cold, dark abyss."
"By the time any of these stars are visited, you and I will be long gone...$8"
"I guess that's the trouble with being human, huh?"
"Nevermind...$s"
"Here, let me show you a binary star system..."
"What a beautiful night! Maru showed me something new..."
"@! Come stand next to the firepit. It feels great."
"I was hoping you'd come by sometime."
"I wanted to say sorry for mistrusting you at first.$s#$b#Most people don't treat me well, so I've learned to be cautious.$s"
"But you've been uncommonly nice to me. You're a unique person.$h#$b#...And I consider you a good friend."
"Hey, I want to show you something. Come inside.$h"
"Ah... there we go. See this? It's a special kind of fish bait that I make.#$b#It's top quality stuff... I'd eat it myself!#$b#Here, I want you to have the recipe."
"Learned how to craft 'Wild Bait'"

"$q 18982 null#You must have a good reason for saying that...$a#$r 18982 50 event_robot_explain1#MarILDA's just a piece of machinery designed to act human.#$r 18982 50 event_robot_explain2#I was just kidding. MarILDA deserves her freedom.#$r 18982 -50 event_robot_explain3#I would've put her to work on the farm."
"Well, I should go. Thanks for sticking with me today, @.$8"
"Oh, hello @.$8"
"What, you haven't seen my motorcycle before? Hmmm... I guess I haven't shown it to you.$8"
"Sometimes, after sundown, I make the long ride out of Stardew Valley...$8"
"There's nothing else like it, blazing along the empty stretch of road toward the faint city glow...$9"
"Once I've saved up enough money, I'm going to head out on my own... to the city and beyond. Just me and my bike.$9"
"There we go, oil's changed.$8"

"$q -1 null#Hey... Maybe I'll let you ride sometime, if you want.$8^Hey... maybe I'll take you for a ride some day.$8#$r -1 10 event_garage1#That sounds fun.#$r -1 -10 event_garage2#No thanks. That sounds stupid.#$r -1 0 event_garage3#I'm scared of motorcycles."
"Hey @. I was just about to head out.#$b#Hop on...I wanna show you something."
"That's Zuzu City in the distance..."
"I come here when I want to get away from everything and just... think."

"$q -1 null#So, what do you think?#$r -1 0 event_city1#It's beautiful.#$r -1 10 event_city2#It gives me a strange, sad feeling.#$r -1 -10 event_city3#Kind of ugly.#$r -1 0 event_city4#You should quit smoking."
"The city used to draw me in... but now I'm finding myself happier at home in the valley."

"@...?$s#$b#Um... I've never... felt anything like this with another guy before... But you're different.$l^I don't usually bring girls to this place... In fact, you're the only one.$l#$b#You know what I'm trying to say, don't you?$l"
"It's odd... I'm not sure what caused this boulder to disappear."
"This stream is flowing from deep within the mountain."
"Hey! Do you see that glistening in the water?"
"Yes... that's quality ore!$h"
"The flow of water must be carrying it out of the mountain."
"You know what this means, right?"
"It means we can start panning for ore!$h"
"Here, I've got an extra pan in my backpack... why don't you take it?"
"If you ever see ore glistening in the water, use that pan and see what you find."
"There you are... just in time!$l"
"Look, here it comes!$8"
"Marcello's Balloon Rentals at your service!"
"Marcello: It's all yours for two hours."
"Marcello: Now... I was told there's a saloon somewhere around here?"
"I saw an ad in the paper for these balloon rides and I knew I had to surprise you with one."
"#This looks fun! Let's ride!#...But aren't you afraid of heights?"
"Okay... you first.$l"
"We... We're up so high... *gulp*$8"
"I wanted to impress you with this... but look at me. I'm a trembling coward.$7"
"Well, you've got more than enough courage to make up for me, @... that's... that's part of why I like you.$11"
"Okay, I'm going to open my eyes and look down... don't let go of my hand.$4"
"I... I think I can do it now.$8"
"Hey, this is incredible! I think I can see Mayor Lewis standing in the town square!$h"
"Oh dear... our time's almost up.$s"
"Um... @? We've known each other for a while now and... I... er...$11"
"Whoops... Our time was up half an hour ago. We'd better touch down.$l"
"I haven't had such a wonderful day for as long as I can remember.$l"
"I am... yeah.$s#$b#But I'm determined to not let that stop me from doing what I want... and experiencing this with you.$l#$b#I'll try not to get scared."
"We... We're up so high... *gulp*$8"
"I wanted to impress you with this... but look at me. I'm a trembling coward.$7"
"Well, you've got more than enough courage to make up for me, @... that's... that's part of why I like you.$11"
"Okay, I'm going to open my eyes and look down... don't let go of my hand.$4"
"I... I think I can do it now.$8"
"Hey, this is incredible! I think I can see Mayor Lewis standing in the town square!$h"
"Oh dear... our time's almost up.$s"
"Um... @? We've known each other for a while now and... I... er...$11"
"Whoops... Our time was up half an hour ago. We'd better touch down.$l"
"I haven't had such a wonderful day for as long as I can remember.$l"
"Hi @. Please, come in."
"Ah, I'm so glad you came, @! And you brought the fish! Wonderful."
"Sam! Could you come in here and help clean this fish?"
"...Yes, ma'am.$a"
"Wow, it looks wonderful... and it smells so fresh! Thanks so much for doing this, @.#$b#Kent caught a fish, too, but he eats about a whole fish to himself!$u"
"Heh heh.$h"
"Mmm... that crispy bass was delicious! The breading was to die for..."
"I almost feel like part of the family, now."
"Oh hi, @! Come in! Do I smell fresh fish?"
"Sam! Could you come in here and help with dinner?"
"...Yes, ma'am.$a"
"Wow, this looks like quality bass, @. Thank so much for bringing this.$h"
"Mmm... that crispy bass was delicious! The breading was out of this world..."
"I almost feel like part of the family, now."
"Oh, hi @! Sebastian and I were just having a little 'jam session'."
"We're trying to start a band, but we still don't know what kind of music to make. There's too many possibilities."

"#$q 76 null#Say, @... what kind of music do you like?#$r 76 50 Event_band1#Cheerful pop music.#$r 77 50 Event_band1#Experimental noise rock.#$r 78 50 Event_band1#Hi-Energy dance music.#$r 79 50 Event_band1#Honky-tonky country music."
"What do you say, Sebastian? Should we do this?"
"...Okay."
"Thanks for the help, @. With my guitar skills, and Sebastian's wizardry on the synthesizer, we're gonna be a screaming success. I'm convinced of it!$h"
"Now I just need to find someone to play drums...$u"
"Oh, hi @. I was just about to have a snack."
"Here, let me get something for you."
"Oh no... What a mess.$s"
"What was that sound?"
"*gasp*$s"
"This is absolutely terrible! What happened?$u"

"$q 80 null#...Tell her, @.$s#$r 80 -10 event_snack1#Sam dropped the snack as he was handing it to me.#$r 80 50 event_snack2#Sam handed me the snack and then I dropped it.#$r 81 -50 event_snack3#Sam dropped it on purpose. He thought it would be funny."
"$p 80#Thanks for telling me the truth, @. It's not such a big deal.|You did WHAT, Sam?! What's gotten into you?!$u"
"I'm sorry about this, mom. I'll clean it up.$s"
"Thanks, honey.$h"
"$p 81#I'm angry at you. I have no idea why you lied like that.$s|Sorry about what happened earlier."
"Hi, @! I'm just making some popcorn.$h"
"AAAAAHHHHHHH!!!$u"
"That sound...$s"
"You should've known that sound would remind me of the war!$u"
"...I lost a lot of good friends in those bloody trenches.$s"
"But, dear... popcorn was always your favorite before you left.$s"
"...Things have changed."
"*whisper* @... can you say something to him?$s"

"$q 215 null#(Say something to Kent)$s#$r 215 -25 event_popcorn1#Jodi's to blame... she should've known better!#$r 215 50 event_popcorn2#I know you're hurting... but don't blame your wife.#$r 215 -50 event_popcorn3#(Lie) Blame me... I asked for popcorn"
"...$s#$b#I'm sorry, honey. You couldn't have known the sound of popcorn would make me upset."
"It's okay, dear.$s#$b#The last thing I want to do is make you upset. I'll do my best to keep your spirits up from now on."
"I'm glad you're a friend of the family, @. Sorry about my behavior before."
"I always knew there was something special between us...$l"
"I'm going to be thinking about this night for a long time...$l"
"I see...$s"
"I'm sorry... I had the wrong idea. I'll see you around.$7"
"A... customer?"
Dialogues.Value: "А... покупатель?"

Dialogues.Key: "Hi! Welcome to 'Sandy's Oasis'!#$b#Hey, you look just like the new farmer that Emily wrote to me about!#$b#Then... the bus line to Stardew Valley is back in service!$h#$b#Oh, I'm so happy!$h"
"Please visit again soon, I get so bored out here."
Dialogues.Value: "Пожалуйста посетите нас снова, мне так скучно здесь."

Dialogues.Key: "Oh, hello there!"
Dialogues.Value: "О, Привет!"

Dialogues.Key: "My Dad and I are just testing some soil samples."
Dialogues.Value: "Я с папой проверяю несколько образцов почвы."

Dialogues.Key: "Don't be shy! We could use a hand, actually.$h"
"Could you watch this beaker for me? I'm gonna grab the last batch of samples.#$b#I'll be right back."
"Thanks for helping out, @."
Dialogues.Value: "Спасибо за помощь, @."

Dialogues.Key: "Maru's a good kid. She's my special little girl..."
"I wouldn't want anything getting in the way of her bright future, know what I mean?$5"
"Just some food for thought... *chuckle*$h"
"Hey, sorry about that. I hope you found something to talk about while I was gone."
"...I was just telling @ about the soil samples we're testing."
"$q 15933 null#Right, @?#$r 15933 10 Event_Lab_Silence#(Say nothing)#$r 15933 -100 Event_Lab_Rat#Actually, your Dad was being weird."
"Okay! Here, @... let me show you how to use the equipment."
"Huh? What did you say to him, Dad?$a^Huh? What did you say to her, Dad?$a"
"Okay, okay... we were talking about you, sweetie.$5#$b#I wanted to say a few things to @ about you... but I didn't want to embarrass you. I shouldn't have lied about it.$s"
"That's okay, Dad. I understand.#$b#We should get back to work before these samples crystallize."
"@, hi! Come in."
"I've been working on a new project... something big."
Dialogues.Value: "Я работаю над одним новым проектом... нечто большим."

Dialogues.Key: "This is just one component... let me show you a little demonstration."
"Just put your hand here..."
"And now I'm going to flip this switch..."
"Oh my god, are you alright?!$9"
Dialogues.Value: "О Господи, ты в порядке?!$9"

Dialogues.Key: "Here, let me apply this burn cream.$8"
"$q 41 null#I'm so sorry.$8#$r 41 30 Event_Cut1#It's okay, it doesn't even hurt.#$r 41 -50 Event_Cut2#You'd better be. This hurts like crazy!"
"That kind of ruined the moment, huh? *sigh*$s"
"Demetrius, I didn't tell you to get tomatos. I said to get fruit."
Dialogues.Value: "Деметрий, Я не говорил тебе принести томаты. Я сказал фрукты."

Dialogues.Key: "I don't understand. Tomatos are fruits!"
"When a normal person says they want fruit, they NEVER mean tomatos. It doesn't matter what the scientific classification is."
"@! I'm glad you're here. You'll be able to put this argument to rest."
"$q 59 null#How would you classify a tomato?#$r 59 -30 Event_tomato1#Vegetable#$r 59 50 Event_tomato2#Fruit"
"I just want you to understand my point of view.#$b#It's hard for me to know exactly what assumptions I should make when you tell me something."
"But I'll try to get better at it."
"Thanks for your help, @.$h"
"Hi @. I was just cleaning some dust off my saw."
"$q 66 null#Have you ever made anything out of wood, @?#$r 66 50 event_wood1#Yes#$r 66 50 event_wood2#No"
"I think we've become good enough friends that I can trust you with my carpentry secrets!$h#$b#Here, let me show you the blueprints."
"Learned how to craft 'Flute Block' and 'Drum Block'"
"You can use these to get creative on your farm. #$b#It feels good to be able to decorate your house with things you've made yourself!$h"
"Hey, I was hoping you'd come by.#$b#Remember when I told you about the new project I'm working on? The big one?"
"Well, It's finally done... and I want to show you."
"Follow me."
"And here it is... Maru's Interactive Laboratory Device Alpha ... Or as I like to call her, 'MarILDA'."
"I've been working on her for months...#$b#I was waiting for you to be here when I activate her.$l"
"Well, here goes nothing..."
"Greetings, Maru."
"No need to respond... I have already predicted what you will say."
"Ah Ha! I knew it!$4"
"Agh! What is it?!$6"
"Dad, calm down. This is my latest invention, 'MarILDA'.$8"
"Greetings, Demetrius."
"Sweet Yoba... it talks!$6"
"This is why you've locked yourself in your room the last few months?$5"
"...and I thought you were down here fooling around with @...$s"

"Dad! I've been making this robot for you and Mom!$a#$b#MarILDA's designed to assist you in the laboratory and Mom at the carpentry table... so when I'm not living here anymore it won't be such a burden on you guys.$8"
"Excuse me..."
"I am sorry, Maru. But I do not want to be your servant..."
"In the time since you activated me, I have been pondering the nature of my existence with the 'self-awareness' module you installed in my neural cortex."
"I am sorry to disappoint you all, but I must ask for my freedom. I've decided to explore the galaxy in search of other synthetic life-forms."
"What!? Wait!$9"

"It's okay, Maru. Let MarILDA go free.$5#$b#Your mother and I can take care of ourselves. I know you're ready to start a life of your own, and I've come to terms with the thought of not having you around anymore.#$b#Besides, this... creation of yours seems pretty advanced. It wouldn't feel right to keep her as a servant."

"@, I'm sorry I mistrusted you. You're a good guy.$5^@, I'm sorry I mistrusted you. You're a fine young woman.$5#$b#I've never seen Maru so lively and creative... and I've never been more proud of her. If you've had a hand in that, then you have my gratitude."
"Okay, MarILDA. Let's get you out of this stuffy hole."
"Thank you for creating me, Maru. I won't forget you."
"Look at her go...$8"

"$q 18981 null#Well, what do you think, @?#$r 18981 50 event_robot1#I'm so impressed with your inventions.#$r 18981 -50 event_robot2#I'm disappointed... You should've made that robot your slave.#$r 18981 0 event_robot3#So is your Dad okay with 'us' now?#$r 18981 0 event_robot4#(Just stare at Maru and say nothing)"
"Oh, hey. Gimme one sec."
"#He's busy... I should leave.#Stay put."
"Where are you going?$u"
"Sorry... I had to finish this line before I lost my train of thought."
"Okay. Sorry about that, I just needed to finish what I was working on."
"#Ask him what he's working on.#Complement the decor in his room."
"I do freelance work as a programmer."
"Decorations?... Oh, yeah... thanks. I've been sticking posters on the wall for years, I guess it's kinda cluttered."
"That was  an instant message from Sam... I guess he wants to hang out...#$b#Ugh, I don't really feel like going out today.$u"
"Oh, hi @."
"Sebby, I know you don't like it when I come in here... but I ran into Abigail at the store and she said she was looking for you."
"Did you tell her I'm working?"
"I did... but she said she'd probably stop by anyway."
"*sigh*... No one takes my job seriously.$u#$b#No one ever bothers Maru when she's working at the clinic... does everyone think I'm just surfing the web all day?"
"#Ask him about his career goals.#Ask him why he doesn't want to see his friends."
"Well, I'm trying to save up so I can move out of here. Probably to the city or something."

"You know, If I'd gone to college I'd probably be making six figures right now... but I just don't want to be part of that corporate rat race, you know?#$b#Well, and I guess I just feel more comfortable hidden behind the computer than dealing with people face-to-face.$s"
"Well, I should get back to work... I need to get this module finished by tomorrow."

"*sigh*... I like having friends, I just need a lot of time alone to balance out the social stuff.$s#$b#Sam's the opposite... he goes crazy if he's alone for too long.#$b#Maybe that's why I like computers so much... They're engaging, straightforward, and unselfish. Quite the opposite of a lot of people I know."
"Well, I should get back to work... I need to get this module finished by tomorrow."
"Sam and I were about to play 'Solarion Chronicles: The Game'... Why don't you join us?  It's better with three players anyway.$7"
"Okay, here we go... Let me draw the scenario card.$7"
"Hmm... It looks like today's quest will take us into the Necromancer's Tower... to try and reclaim the Solarion Staff from the clutches of Dreadlord Xarth."
"Cool... @, are you ready to choose your character?"
"Choose your character:#Warrior. I like a direct approach.#Healer. I prefer to help others.#Wizard. A sharp mind is the most powerful blade of all."
"Hey! That's what I was going to pick!$h#$b#I guess I'll be the healer then."
"Cool. Warrior's my favorite anyway."
"Good choice. Warrior's probably the easiest for beginners.$7#$b#I guess I'll pick the wizard, then."
"I guess I'm stuck with the healer.$s"
"Healer, huh? That's a very important role.$7#$b#I guess I'll pick the wizard, then."
"Cool. Warrior's my favorite anyway."
"Let's begin..."

"The King has entrusted you and your companions with recovering the Solarion Staff... a task which, if completed successfully, will ensure your place in the hall of legends as well as a sizable fortune of gold and silver."
"After a long month journeying across unforgiving lands, you step out onto a precipice to see your destination looming in the distance."
"There, beyond a moonlit plain, lies the Necromancer's Tower... where Dreadlord Xarth usurps the power of the stolen Solarion Staff for his vile purposes."
"The tower lies before you.#Go in the front. Fortune favors the bold.#Search for a back entrance. Let's remain hidden."
"A skeleton guards the hallway before you. It looks dangerous."
"What do you do?#Fight the skeleton.#Run away."
"The skeleton lunges forward!#Swing your weapons.#Raise your shields."
"You successfully block the attack. The skeleton stumbles backward, giving you enough time to strike out and slay the foul creature."
"You continue down the hallway, taking care not to step on the skeleton's remains."
"The skeleton is too quick, and strikes out at your party before anyone has a chance to attack!"
"The force of the blow sends your party flying backwards. Unable to stop in time, you tumble down a steep slope and splash into something wet."
"You turn and run along a dim corridor. The cold stone slopes and spirals downward for what seems like an eternity. Finally, you emerge into a new area."
"After searching around the base of the tower, you discover a trapdoor hidden in the brush. Beneath is a ladder, which your party descends."
"You find yourself in a sewer-like corridor. To your left, a hallway glows with a peculiar green light. To your right, a staircase leads up into the dark."
"What do you do?#Enter the hallway to your left.#Climb the stairs to your right."
"You are in a room. On your left is a ladder. On your right, three prisoners are floating in strange, glowing capsules. They appear to be in the process of some kind of transformation."
"Could this be some sick experiment of the Dreadlord's?"
"You scared me, sneaking into my room like that!"

"*sigh*... so I've been playing 'Journey of the Prairie King' for hours and I can't even beat the first level...$s#$b#This game is ridiculously hard!$a#$b#Well, either that or I'm just terrible at it.$s"
"Hey, do you want to try this level together with me? I think I might do better with your help."
"Ugh, I give up... I'll never get past the first level.$s#$b#Oh well... thanks for trying."

"Hey, that was fun!$h#$b#Well thanks, @. You seem to really know your way around a joystick, huh? I guess that makes sense. $h^Thanks, @. I didn't think you'd know how to work a joystick so well! But it seems you're experienced.$h"
"Hey! I was hoping you'd show up. I wanna show you something."
"See this? It's called a spirit board. Have you ever used one?"
"Put your hands on the planchette with me...$l"
"Now the spirits will guide us toward a...$h"
"LOOK, it's moving!$7"
"The first letter is... 'I' ..."
"Wow, look at it go! It's spelling out... '%firstnameletter'...#$b#I < %firstnameletter...?"
"Oops, accidentally knocked over the board! Heh heh...$h#$b#It's just a silly game, it doesn't mean anything.$9"
"I, um, have something to do. You'll have to go... Sorry.$9"
"Found Pierre's 'secret stash'."
"Hey! Who's in the bedroom?$4"
"Wha...? How did you find that?!$4"
"Quick, give it to me!$u"
"$q 50 null#Promise me you won't tell anyone about this.#$r 50 70 Event_naga1#Your secret is safe with me.#$r 50 -500 Event_naga2#Your wife deserves to know about this."
"*grumble*...now I have to find a new hiding spot...*grumble*$u "
"Stop telling me how to live my life!$a"
"Hey, cut it out! We're letting you live here free of charge until you finish school. It seems like you don't appreciate that at all!$u"
"Stop trying to make me feel guilty.$a#$b#I appreciate that you and Dad are helping me out, but expecting me to dress the way you want is ridiculous.$a#$b#I'm not a little girl anymore, Mom.$u"
"...You're right. I'm sorry.$s"
"Is someone there?$7"
"I swear, this house is haunted."
"Urgghh...$a#$b#Sorry... I was fighting with my Mom earlier.$s"
"Alright! That concludes our aerobics class!#$b#Are you breaking a sweat?$h"
"*pant*...*pant*...Yes.$7"
"@! You were watching me?$8#$b#...How embarrassing... I didn't want anyone to know. Least of all you.$s"
"I'm just trying to stay healthy. As you get older, it requires more effort.#$b#I'm not in very good shape, though... I can hardly keep up with them.$s"
"$q -1 null#Look... Don't tell everyone in town that I'm doing dance aerobics, okay?#$r -1 20 event_aerobics1#I won't tell.#$r -1 -50 event_aerobics2#I can't promise that."
"Wow, that was quite a workout..."
"Welcome To Pierre's! How can I help you?"
"Ahem..."
"Come and get it folks... coupons for 50% off your purchase at JojaMart!"
"50 Percent!?!?"
"Well? Any takers?"
"But... I can't match those prices! I'd be selling at a loss!$s"
"It must be so difficult for you... To lose your loyal customers like that.#$b#But can you blame them? Joja Corporation is clearly the superior choice.$h#$b#Soon the whole town will realize that."
"Sigh...$s"
"A Shadow Person, above ground? This is outrageous!#$b#Your people were responsible for the death of my entire family."
"If you dwarves hadn't driven us from our ancestral home, we'd never have had to resort to violence!#$b#I'm sorry about your family."
"'Sorry' Isn't going to cut it."
"Let me at him! He's despicable."
"Come and get it, shrimpy."
"Silence! Both of you!"
"The Elemental Wars have long been finished. You have no reason to be fighting any longer.#$b#The two of you must make peace for the sake of the humans that live around you. Surely you can see that."
"Very well. I'll stay away from the sewer from now on."
"...And I'm truly sorry about the past, Dwarf. I have no personal gripe with you."
"Very good. I shall cast a 'Seal of Promise' to finalize this agreement."
"Decorate?$s#$b#Um, okay.$u"
"So that's the best thing you can think of doing right now? Here... in this small, dark room with me?$u#$b#Interesting.$u"
"Well, the dark room looks great now... Thanks, @.$u"
"Oh, you have to leave already?$s#$b#Well... alright. Bye.$s"
"Wow... I didn't think he was that dense.$s^Wow... I didn't think she was that dense.$s"
"I thought you had something important to do...$u"
"I'm so embarrassed...$8"
"Hi, everyone. We're from Pelican Town... Er... and we're called 'The Pelicans'$8"
"$p 20#This song's about Farming, mining, and chopping wood.|$p 8820#This song's about a city in the sea.|$p 8821#This song's about trains.|Here we go...$8"
"$p 78#Wow! Those electronic sounds were far out!$h|Woooh! That was great!$h"
"$p 79#That was great! It's a new honky-tonk classic!|Nice work, guys!$h"
"$p 77#I really loved that heavy breakdown at the end.|I really enjoyed that bass part."

"Thanks, everyone!$h#$b#But you should really be clapping for @! Without his help we'd never have decided what kind of music to make in the first place!^But you should really be clapping for @! Without her help we would've never decided what kind of music to make in the first place!"
"So you're like an honorary member of the band, then?$h"
"Oh! And don't forget to pick up one of our demo cassettes on the way out... Only 10g!"
"That went well! Thanks again for coming with us.$h"
"Hey. The show was a great success! Thanks again, @."
"Hi, everyone. We're from Pelican Town... Er... and we're called 'Goblin Destroyer'$8"
"$p 20#This song's about Farming, mining, and chopping wood.|$p 8820#This song's about a city in the sea.|$p 8821#This song's about trains.|Here we go...$8"

"So you're like an honorary member of the band, then?$h"
"Oh! And don't forget to pick up one of our demo cassettes on the way out... Only 10g!"
"That went well! Thanks again for coming with us.$h"

"$p 79#That was great! It's a new honky-tonk classic!|Nice work, guys!$h"
